intro: Strobilanthes agasthyamalana, commonly known as the Agasthyamalai strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments, often in the undergrowth of dense vegetation. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
